ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend it to other students. The course provide a good review on genetics history and recent progress.
I would summarize it as a class that teaches you how to present papers and ask good questions. The work load is appropriate and Valentina is a great instructor.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student, for several reasons:1) improves presentation skills2) interaction with other PIs3) great way to get to know your fellow students (especially important in Genetics because everyone entered from a much larger track)4) learned alot about diverse topics
Pretty interesting class, got to read some good papers, some a little more boring papers.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The class provides a broad view of many exciting fields in the current biological research. And it helps to build a solid understanding of the overall.

Although the subject matter of this course wasn't directly related to my research, I feel I benefitted three-fold:1) improved my presentation skills2) learned about diverse areas, some of which piqued my interest and I may follow up on them at some point3) got to know my fellow students, which will be of great reward in future years
It helped to inform me of the research that is going on in genetics outside my particular subfield.
